meanings.definition: Believing that all living things are equally important
meanings.sent1: The biocentric view values every living creature equally.
meanings.sent2: She has a biocentric approach, considering all organisms as equally significant.
meanings.sent3: In a biocentric world, even the tiniest insect holds great importance.
meanings.sent4: Her biocentric perspective sees the world as a harmonious web of life.
meanings.sent5: The biocentric philosophy teaches us to respect all forms of life.

meanings.definition: Focused on the importance of living organisms
meanings.sent1: Their biocentric research highlights the significance of all living beings.
meanings.sent2: A biocentric mindset recognizes the vital role of living organisms in ecosystems.
meanings.sent3: The biocentric approach emphasizes the crucial role of plants and animals.
meanings.sent4: His biocentric perspective sees nature as a delicate balance of living entities.
meanings.sent5: The biocentric viewpoint reminds us of the interconnectedness of all living things.

meanings.definition: Centered on the idea that life is the most valuable thing
meanings.sent1: The biocentric philosophy places utmost value on the essence of life.
meanings.sent2: Living a biocentric lifestyle means cherishing the value of life above all.
meanings.sent3: In a biocentric society, life itself is considered the greatest treasure.
meanings.sent4: Her biocentric beliefs highlight the preciousness of every living being.
meanings.sent5: The biocentric perspective reminds us to treasure the gift of life.
